name: Pradhan Mantri Jan Arogya Yojana (PM-JAY)
shortDescription: A flagship health insurance scheme providing coverage of ₹5 lakhs per family per year for secondary and tertiary care hospitalization.
coverage: Up to ₹5 lakhs per family per year
eligibility: Families identified based on deprivation categories in rural areas
Defined occupational categories in urban areas
All families included in the SECC database
No restriction on family size, age, or pre-existing conditions
benefits: Cashless and paperless access at point of service
Coverage for 3 days of pre-hospitalization and 15 days post-hospitalization expenses
All pre-existing diseases covered from day one
Coverage for 1,950+ medical procedures including surgeries, medical treatments, and daycare
No restriction on family size, age or gender
applicationProcess: Check eligibility using your mobile number, SECC ID, Ration Card, or Aadhaar
Visit the nearest empanelled hospital or PM-JAY registration center with identification
Submit required documents for verification
Receive your e-card after verification
Use the e-card to avail cashless treatment at any empanelled hospital

hindi.name: प्रधानमंत्री जन आरोग्य योजना (पीएम-जेएवाई)
hindi.shortDescription: माध्यमिक और तृतीयक अस्पताल में भर्ती के लिए प्रति परिवार प्रति वर्ष ₹5 लाख का कवरेज प्रदान करने वाली एक प्रमुख स्वास्थ्य बीमा योजना।

tamil.name: பிரதான் மந்திரி ஜன் ஆரோக்கியா யோஜனா (பிஎம்-ஜேஏவை)
tamil.shortDescription: இரண்டாம் மற்றும் மூன்றாம் நிலை மருத்துவமனைச் சேர்க்கைக்கு ஒரு குடும்பத்திற்கு ஒரு வருடத்திற்கு ₹5 லட்சம் காப்பீடு வழங்கும் முன்னணி சுகாதார காப்பீட்டுத் திட்டம்.

name: Ayushman Bharat Health Infrastructure Mission
shortDescription: A major initiative to develop capacities of health systems and institutions across the continuum of care at all levels to prepare health systems to respond effectively to current and future pandemics/disasters.
coverage: Pan-India coverage with focus on rural, tribal, and urban slum areas
eligibility: All citizens benefitting from improved public health infrastructure
Special focus on underserved areas including rural and tribal regions
Urban slums and areas with poor health indicators
benefits: Establishment of critical care hospital blocks in 602 districts
Integrated Public Health Labs in all districts
Block Public Health Units in 3,382 blocks
5 Regional National Centers for Disease Control
20 Metropolitan Health Surveillance Units
Strengthened diagnostic capacity and research
applicationProcess: This is an infrastructure development scheme, not an individual application-based program
Citizens benefit from improved healthcare infrastructure automatically
For information, visit the official website or contact local health authorities

hindi.name: आयुष्मान भारत स्वास्थ्य अवसंरचना मिशन
hindi.shortDescription: वर्तमान और भविष्य की महामारियों/आपदाओं का प्रभावी ढंग से जवाब देने के लिए स्वास्थ्य प्रणालियों को तैयार करने हेतु सभी स्तरों पर देखभाल के निरंतरता के माध्यम से स्वास्थ्य प्रणालियों और संस्थानों की क्षमताओं को विकसित करने के लिए एक प्रमुख पहल।

name: Rashtriya Bal Swasthya Karyakram (RBSK)
shortDescription: A child health screening and early intervention program aimed at early identification and treatment of 4 Ds - Defects at birth, Diseases, Deficiencies, and Developmental delays including disabilities.
coverage: All children from birth to 18 years of age
eligibility: All newborns born at public health facilities and home
All children enrolled in Anganwadi centers
All government and government-aided school children
benefits: Screening for health conditions, defects at birth, diseases, deficiencies, and developmental delays
Early detection and management of health conditions
Free treatment including surgeries at tertiary level
Referral support and treatment
Mobile health teams visiting schools and anganwadis
applicationProcess: No separate application needed as screening is conducted at healthcare facilities, anganwadis, and schools
Children identified with health conditions during screening are referred to appropriate facilities
For surgeries, children are referred to empanelled hospitals
Parents can contact nearest PHC, CHC or District Early Intervention Center for more information

hindi.name: राष्ट्रीय बाल स्वास्थ्य कार्यक्रम (आरबीएसके)
hindi.shortDescription: जन्म के समय विकृति, बीमारियों, कमियों और विकासात्मक देरी सहित विकलांगता - 4 डी के शीघ्र पहचान और उपचार पर लक्षित एक बाल स्वास्थ्य स्क्रीनिंग और प्रारंभिक हस्तक्षेप कार्यक्रम।

name: Janani Shishu Suraksha Karyakram (JSSK)
shortDescription: A scheme that entitles all pregnant women delivering in public health institutions to absolutely free and no expense delivery including caesarean section, along with free transport and care for sick infants.
coverage: All pregnant women and sick newborns up to 30 days after birth
eligibility: All pregnant women going to government health institutions for delivery
All sick newborns accessing public health institutions for treatment up to 30 days after birth
benefits: Free delivery (normal or cesarean) at public health institutions
Free medicines and consumables during delivery and post-delivery complications
Free diagnostics and blood transfusion if required
Free diet during stay at the health institutions
Free transport from home to health institution, between facilities in case of referral, and drop back home
Exemption from all user charges
applicationProcess: No formal application process is required
Pregnant women can directly visit the nearest government healthcare facility
Register at the facility by providing basic identity information
For transport services, contact the local ASHA worker or call 108/102 ambulance services

hindi.name: जननी शिशु सुरक्षा कार्यक्रम (जेएसएसके)
hindi.shortDescription: एक योजना जो सार्वजनिक स्वास्थ्य संस्थानों में प्रसव कराने वाली सभी गर्भवती महिलाओं को बिल्कुल मुफ्त और बिना किसी खर्च के सिजेरियन सेक्शन सहित प्रसव का अधिकार देती है, साथ ही बीमार शिशुओं के लिए मुफ्त परिवहन और देखभाल भी प्रदान करती है।

name: National Health Mission (NHM)
shortDescription: An umbrella program focusing on universal access to health care through strengthening health systems, institutions, and capabilities of both rural and urban areas.
coverage: Pan-India coverage including both rural and urban areas
eligibility: All citizens benefitting from improved public health infrastructure and services
Special focus on rural areas (NRHM) and urban areas (NUHM)
Emphasis on marginalized groups, women, and children
benefits: Improved access to quality health services
Strengthened health infrastructure including Sub-Centers, PHCs, and CHCs
Reduced out-of-pocket expenditure on healthcare
Comprehensive primary health care through Health and Wellness Centers
Disease control programs for TB, Malaria, Blindness, etc.
Maternal and child health initiatives
Free emergency response services (108 Ambulance)
applicationProcess: This is a systemic health improvement program, not an individual application-based scheme
Citizens benefit from improved healthcare services automatically
For specific services, visit the nearest public health facility
Connect with local ASHA workers for healthcare guidance in rural areas

hindi.name: राष्ट्रीय स्वास्थ्य मिशन (एनएचएम)
hindi.shortDescription: स्वास्थ्य प्रणालियों, संस्थानों और ग्रामीण और शहरी दोनों क्षेत्रों की क्षमताओं को मजबूत करके स्वास्थ्य देखभाल तक सार्वभौमिक पहुंच पर ध्यान केंद्रित करने वाला एक व्यापक कार्यक्रम।

name: National Programme for Prevention and Control of Cancer, Diabetes, Cardiovascular Diseases & Stroke (NPCDCS)
shortDescription: A program aimed at addressing the growing burden of non-communicable diseases (NCDs) by providing early diagnosis, management, and referral for chronic conditions.
coverage: All citizens, especially those at risk of NCDs
eligibility: All citizens can access NCD screening and treatment services
Focus on population above 30 years for screening
Special emphasis on high risk individuals with family history or risk factors
benefits: Free screening for diabetes, hypertension, and common cancers
Early diagnosis and management of NCDs
Subsidized treatment for cancer, diabetes, CVDs, and stroke
Lifestyle counseling and health promotion
NCD clinics at district and CHC levels
Tertiary care support for advanced cases
Palliative care for terminal stage patients
applicationProcess: Visit your nearest health facility (Sub-center, PHC, CHC) for NCD screening
Screening camps are also organized periodically in communities
If diagnosed, register at the NCD clinic for regular follow-up
Severe cases are referred to district hospitals or tertiary centers with support

hindi.name: कैंसर, मधुमेह, हृदय रोग और स्ट्रोक की रोकथाम और नियंत्रण के लिए राष्ट्रीय कार्यक्रम (एनपीसीडीसीएस)
hindi.shortDescription: पुरानी स्थितियों के लिए प्रारंभिक निदान, प्रबंधन और रेफरल प्रदान करके गैर-संचारी रोगों (एनसीडी) के बढ़ते बोझ को संबोधित करने के उद्देश्य से एक कार्यक्रम।
